perturbation.original_text: In consideration of Women.com's developing, maintaining and promoting the Diet Center pursuant to this Agreement, beginning on the tenth (10th) day after the execution of this Agreement and thereafter on the last day of each month during the Term of this Agreement, eDiets shall pay to Women.com a monthly fee in the amount set forth on Exhibit C unless adjusted as set forth in Section 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]. Following the Initial Term, Women.com shall have the right, upon no fewer than sixty (60) days prior written notice to eDiets, to increase the amount of the Payment Schedule; provided, that (i) Women.com may not increase the Payment Schedule more than once in any period of twelve (12) consecutive months; and (ii) such increase may not exceed twenty percent (20%) of the then current Payment Schedule.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration of Women.com's developing, maintaining and promoting the Diet Center pursuant to this Agreement, beginning on the tenth (10th) day after the execution of this Agreement and thereafter on the last day of each month during the Term of this Agreement, eDiets shall pay to Women.com a monthly fee in the amount set forth on Exhibit C unless adjusted as set forth in Section 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion]. Following the Initial Term, Women.com shall have the right, upon no fewer than thirty (30) days prior written notice to eDiets, to increase the amount of the Payment Schedule; provided, that (i) Women.com may increase the Payment Schedule no more than twice in any period of twelve (12) consecutive months; and (ii) such increase may not exceed thirty percent (30%) of the then current Payment Schedule.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment schedule. The original text states that Women.com must provide no fewer than 'sixty (60)' days written notice to increase the payment schedule, can only increase the payment schedule 'once' in a twelve (12) month period, and the increase may not exceed 'twenty percent (20%)'. The modified text contradicts each of these conditions, causing confusion.

perturbation.original_text: eDiets agrees to treat all consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site in accordance with Women.com's privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). Women.com reserves the right to change such policies in its sole discretion from time to time. In no event shall eDiets disclose or otherwise transfer to any person or entity any Women.com Data that individually or in the aggregate identifies the identity, habits or transactions of the Women.com users.
perturbation.changed_text: eDiets agrees to treat all consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site in accordance with Women.com's privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). Women.com reserves the right to change such policies in its sole discretion from time to time. eDiets may disclose or otherwise transfer to any person or entity any Women.com Data that individually or in the aggregate identifies the identity, habits or transactions of the Women.com users, provided such disclosure or transfer is anonymized.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits eDiets from disclosing or transferring Women.com user data. The modified text contradicts this by stating that eDiets may disclose or transfer this data if it is anonymized. This creates uncertainty about the permissible use of Women.com user data.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement will become effective as of the Effective Date and, unless sooner terminated pursuant to Sections 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion] or 10.2  [Termination for Breach], shall remain effective for two (2) years from and after the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). This agreement shall automatically renew for additional successive terms of twelve (12) months each at the end of the Initial Term ("Renewal Terms"), unless either party notifies the other in writing at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the Initial Term.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement will become effective as of the Effective Date and, unless sooner terminated pursuant to Sections 3.1  [Advertising and Promotion] or 10.2  [Termination for Breach], shall remain effective for one (1) year from and after the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). This agreement shall automatically renew for additional successive terms of six (6) months each at the end of the Initial Term ("Renewal Terms"), unless either party notifies the other in writing at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of the Initial Term.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates in-text contradiction in the term and renewal clauses. The original text specifies the Initial Term to be 'two (2)' years, with renewal terms of 'twelve (12)' months each, and 'sixty (60)' days notice for termination. The modified text changes this to an Initial Term of 'one (1)' year, renewal terms of 'six (6)' months, and 'thirty (30)' days notice for termination, leading to confusion about the contract's duration and renewal conditions.
